one_reviews_text:
I love this game, and yes, you should get it if you want a fun asymetrical co-op experience. I play it with my daughter frequently.

My big gripe is that there's no cross-buy with the Quest 2, which puts a sour taste in my mouth, as I've paid $25 once, and while I love the devs, its weird to have to pay again to use it on the same device I've been using it on, but with the ability to use other computers.
For me and my boyfriends, this is a game that seeks for one of it's kind! It's fun, challenging and a really interessting concept :D

I need some help please. I I'm playing solo so I'm playing as both characters, which is really cool! my problem is that as the reaper man I try to pick up my blocks, but everything's like stuck like glue. I can't get it to let go or go where I want to drop it.  what am I doing wrong?  thanks.
review_feedback:
Sounds really strange! Could you reach out to johan@oddravenstudios.com and I'll try and help you with your issue.

/Johan

one_reviews_text: Every since my wife and I started playing this, our marriage has become incredible. We talk more, we interact much better, and we know how to collaborate much easier. Thanks Game!

My wife and I didn't really enjoy this ourselves, but it is a decent puzzle platformer and one of the few VR games you can play with a non-VR person, so extra star for that.  Decent game overall, just not our cup of tea.
An amazing gem of a local co-op game
This kind of stuff is what VR was made for! me and my 10 year old daughter played this and had an absolute blast! She was the best carly =)

I purchased this with the idea of having a game that my son and I could both play at the same time with the rift and this one fit the bill.  Great cooperative game, not terribly difficult puzzles, but just challenging enough to keep it entertaining.  You can't get through this without communicating and working well as a team.  Kudos to the developer for breaking new ground with this, fantastic concept and well executed!

I almost never write reviews, but this one deserve it. Very cool game mechanics. Played maybe 2 hours with girlfriend and we love it. Not 5 stars because she thinks that the controls of her character (she plays on the screen) is a bit off and she did a few suicides because of the constrained camera, but not much of a big deal. All maxed out graphical settings with an AMD 390X.
review_feedback:
Thank you for the nice review!
Did you try to inverse the camera in settings? We've noticed some players don't realise we have that setting and struggle with camera settings that are opposite of what they want.

one_reviews_text: Really good Puzzle-Platformer for when you have a friend over and only one VR headset.

This is an amazingly fun game. Really good puzzles, and the asymetry adds a unique style of game play that requires true co-op between players. Most puzzles have things that are only visible to each person. So you have to have an open and active dialogue between both players to effectively beat each level. The only reason I'm giving this game 4 stars instead of 5 is because of a consistant framerate dropping that were are seeing. After playing a few levels with the game running flawlessly, the framerate will tank and stay tanked until the game is exited and relaunched. Normally I would say that it's an issue with the persons PC not being able to handle the game, but I'm running an i7 7700K w/ 16 gb of dd4, and a Titan XP gpu. This is the first VR game to give me any issues. When this issue is resolved, I'll happily give it 5 stars.

Edit: Changing my review to 5 stars. The issue I was initially seeing seems to have gone away.
review_feedback: Thank you for the review! Could you send a mail to johan@oddravenstudios.com so we can work with you and find the reason for your issues?

one_reviews_text: This is currently the best local asymmetric co-op VR title on the store. I can't recommend highly enough.
Great fun, perfect for me and my (7 year old) son to play together.

Been playing with my SO and having a blast. The puzzles in this game force the players to talk with each other to solve many different types of challenges. I would reccommend this game to anyone that has an xbox controller to play with.
